Dear Sirs
My apologies for this late reply to your inquiry of February 26*
I have just returned to my desk following a month5 s absence on
an assignment in the Kentucky caves*
Felix Bonvouloir was a member of a special O.S.S. teem In World War
II.
We assigned to re-oapture Radio Stuttgart and t o operate it
as a Voice of Military Government.
Hie Germans* stubbornly retreating, did what they thought to be
a complete job of sabotage. They believed Stuttgart would not
be heard again.
Thanks © Captain Bonvouloir and two other officer-engineers, I
was able to restore the station to the air within two months -
between April 8 to June 15, 1945,
It required much additional assistance, Felix and his two fellow-
officers itemized the damaged parts in a matter of a few days, I
then scattered the rest of my team throughout Germane
v ^
Aided hy Counter-Intelligence Corps and Signal Corps leads, these parts
were assembled and Felix and the two others rebuilt the station,
including new towers to return us to the air before the United States
ha established headquarters in this area of Germany.
For such men and such team-work I have nothing but praise and confidence
in their ability,
I am certain Mr, Bonvouloir will exceed your expectations.
Sincerely,
WBMjJC
/s/ Wm, Burke Miller
Night Executive Officer
